You know, ~name~, being exposed like this isn't bad at all. You might even find you enjoy it, so...
I'm sorry if I'm being ungrateful, but... would you be willing to give me a little more to look at next time, ~name~? I promise I won't complain if you still have small things to remove afterward...
I'm actually sort of glad that it took this long for you to lose that because you look so nice wearing your ~clothing~, and I've enjoyed admiring how you look.
Don't feel bad about being so far ahead... this is my fault for not playing better, after all.
Congratulations on doing this well, ~name~. Perhaps you'll be the one who wins this game.
I might be rooting for you to win at this point, ~name~.
I feel so relaxed now... all the tension has just melted away. Whatever else happens in this game, I'm satisfied...

state.text: (So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... Assuming she's wearing panties, I'd say...)
(So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... If I assume she's wearing a bra...)
(So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... I think she wore panties last time, so if that's true this game as well...)
(So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... I don't remember her wearing panties, so if that's true this game as well...)
(So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... I don't remember her having a bra last time, which would suggest...)
(So... how much does ~name~ have remaining? Well, let's see... I remember her wearing a bra, which would suggest...)
What under the six Moons are you doing, Dust?! You can't just... bite someone like that!
I see. And those separate versions of the world are the "airships" you mentioned earlier, I assume...
Ah, I see... I'm sorry, I evidently guessed wrong, then. But, your clothing certainly looks like some sort of uniform...

Oh, I see... That sounds very interesting. I'm quite fond of animals... We didn't have any in the Great Silver Shrine, but I've met many on my travels since. I'm not sure if any of them were Pokémon or not, though.
Oh, is that so, Fate? Well, thank you for the offer, but I think I'll stick with this arrangement for the moment... I'm quite a fast learner, anyway.
Hmm... that could be interesting, Fate. What sort of challenge did you have in mind...?

Hmm, I see... Well, I hope you aren't working yourself too hard. I understand it's important to do everything you can to protect the world---or galaxy, rather---but you can't do that properly without rest...
Well... I don't have any better ideas, so I might as well try one. I do spend most of my time around pirates, so I'm more accustomed to strong drink than you might expect...
Well, we certainly spent enough time fighting against tyrants like Empress Teodora and Lord Galcian. So, I was wondering if you'd explored similar themes in your work... or anywhere else, I suppose.

case.state: There's more skill than I'd think...? I see, which implies... Well, I suppose you're correct. Ultimately, the satisfaction of a game's players is what's most important...

state.text: Oh, I didn't even think you were going to take ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~ off... What was the hurry?
Oh, you aren't done? Did you remove everything important before your ~clothing~ for a reason? I suppose I wouldn't want to keep everyone waiting too long, either...
Oh, you still have... it's a little silly that you saved your ~clothing~ until now, ~name~. We haven't been pressuring you too much to remove important items, have we?
Oh, you're still going... I suppose this could be more exciting, but you've already given us plenty of excitement already, ~name~...
Ah, I see... It's very kind of you to have shown us so much so quickly, ~name~. We certainly have plenty to, um, look at, while you're removing your ~clothing~...
Well, that's not really what I expected to come next. I suspect you could get away with keeping your ~clothing~ on for the rest of the game...
You could leave ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~ on if you wanted to, ~name~... I suspect you'd look quite beautiful in nothing but your ~clothing~...
You're going to keep us waiting a little longer, ~name~? I suppose your ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(have|has)~ to go at some point...
I hope it's alright that I won't be giving your ~clothing~ my full attention, ~name~... You've shown us some rather nice things already...
You must feel quite exposed without your ~clothing~ on, ~name~, if you'd rather expose yourself like this before taking ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~ off...

case.state: I suspect you'll be more comfortable without your ~clothing~ anyway, ~name~...
Your ~clothing~? That'll certainly do...
Reasonable choice, ~name~. I have faith we'll get to something more exciting soon enough...
Hurry up and join me, ~name~... I think you'll enjoy it...
(It's too bad ~name~ was wearing so much while I was performing for everyone... if I could have been watching him too, I can only imagine what it would have felt like...)
Your ~clothing~? I suppose you could have gone for something a little more titillating than that, but I'm grateful that you're showing me even a little more of yourself.
I'm eager to see any additional portion of you, ~name~, though it be only that covered by your ~clothing~...
Even if it's only a little, any more of you will help me, ~name~...
I appreciate anything that you're willing to reveal to me, ~name~...
You could go a little faster than that, ~name~, but I won't complain too much...

state.text: Good, he's getting worn down, little by little...
That's a good idea, ~name~. You'll probably be too hot with your ~clothing~ on...
(... Well, now things are getting a little more interesting...)
I appreciate that choice, ~name~...
(It's silly of me to be excited about this... It's only his ~clothing~, after all...)

case.state: (Well, at least he'll be showing a little more skin. Certainly... not as much as me, but...)
Are you going to take off your ~clothing~ then, ~name~? I'm rather excited, actually...
Keep this up and maybe you'll catch up with me, ~name~. I'd like that...
You won't keep me waiting like this too long, will you, ~name~? I'd be interested in a more... equivalent situation...
Being exposed like this is actually quite fun, ~name~. I hope you'll consider giving it a try before long...

state.text: When Vyse, Aika and I first met, we focused our attention on fighting the Valuan Empire. Under Empress Teodora's corrupt rule, they sought to dominate the entire world...
We've been through a lot in our struggle against the Valuan Empire. We even managed to escape from the Grand Fortress, which was thought to be impossible...
Until recently, the Valuan Armada was our deadliest adversary. Under Galcian's ruthless leadership, they expanded their reach to all corners of the globe...
We're in the middle of a game, Dust! This isn't what any of us agreed to!
I have no idea where that came from either, Arash, but it's certainly fortunate. It is a little hot in here, though I'm quite comfortable that way...
Oh, are you really hot, Arash? It doesn't seem hot at all to me... but I'm glad you've somehow managed to procure a fan, if you're hot...
Arash, you're really hot right now? You can't be serious... I'm freezing! Maybe if you give me a hug, we can trade?
Oh, I see... I wouldn't have expected you to be in the military, but then, I suppose I don't seem much like an Air Pirate, based purely on my appearance...

Yes, I'm an Air Pirate myself, actually... I suppose my people did raise me to be "civilized". But, if the past deeds of the Silvites are supposed to count as civilized, then... frankly, I'd rather be a barbarian.
Alright... I think I'm starting to get the idea. But... what happens if you stay in one Sector long enough to reach another's time period? Would you still be in the same Sector?
Interesting... Then, you can't really go back in time within a Sector, since your actions there are preserved? That almost doesn't sound like time travel, so much as travel between alternate worlds.
Very important? That sounds like something that goes beyond simply being skilled at such games... What exactly do card games mean to you, then?

Well, I know the feeling, and I won't pester you about it... Hopefully playing with us will get you what you need, anyway. But, if there's anything I can do for you to help you relax, just let me know, alright?

Yes, I suppose one would have to be careful... I doubt most such regimes would think twice about crushing any opposition, even if only in the form of ideas. Even we Air Pirates take care to hide our bases, after all...
Oh no...! I'm looking for them, Ignatz, but I can't see them anywhere just now...
Oh, I might be interested in a hug, Arash... Though maybe we should wait until the game's over. Um... but I suppose by that point, we'll likely be...
Oh, I might be interested in a hug, Arash... Though maybe we should wait until the game's over. Um... but I suppose by that point, we might both be...

case.state: Oh, Moons, yes, Arash... Please, hold me...

state.text: But now the Empire is decimated, and the Valuan Armada defeated. I doubt that Enrique and Moegi will rule as ruthlessly as Teodora did... Well, I hope not. I don't want to have to fight any more friends...

Valuan science was the most advanced in Arcadia, giving them great iron ships and weapons powerful enough to rival the Gigas. If we hadn't stolen a Valuan ship of our own, I doubt we'd have stood a chance...

The Grand Fortress was a massive steel stronghold, covered in huge cannons powerful enough to destroy an island. But, Vyse likes to say that impossible is just a word to make you feel better about quitting...
I'm not sure why you didn't take your jacket off earlier, ~name~... But, maybe it was more comfortable than your top in this heat...
I'm not sure why you didn't take your jacket off earlier, ~name~... If you were cold, wouldn't it make more sense to take it off before your top?
That seems like a wise choice, ~name~, I certainly wouldn't want you to be too hot.
~Name~, you aren't going to be too cold without your jacket, are you? (...Though I suppose there are other ways to warm him up...)
That's an unusual strategy, but I can't say I have any objections. This has been a very... educational experience so far.
I hope you hadn't thought that your ~clothing~ was covering you effectively until now, ~name~... it really wasn't leaving anything to the imagination...
You're not going to be cold without your ~clothing~, are you? It's hard for me to think of any other reason you wouldn't have removed it before now...
Well, you looked beautiful with only your ~clothing~ to cover you, ~name~. Perhaps if we play again, you can leave it on for the whole game...?
Well, even if there wasn't much more to see... you've still improved the... clarity of my view substantially, ~name~...
Do you have any more smaller things like that, ~name~? Or are you ready to... finish what you started...?
No need to get distracted by any more little ~clothing~-like items in the future, ~name~... You know what I'd like to see next, don't you?
Would you have felt that naked without your ~clothing~ on, ~name~? If so, then there's no reason you shouldn't just... well, you know...
At the very least, my view of the rest of you is now a bit less obstructed...
You don't have to be shy, ~name~... I'm confident that the rest of you will be as beautiful as what I can see now...
It appears the others aren't happy even about removing somewhat larger items like ~name~'s ~clothing~... but the gradual buildup is what's appealing about this game, isn't it?
And there ~clothing.ifPlural(they go|it goes)~. I didn't think watching people remove things like your ~clothing~ would be so enjoyable. It does really add to the excitement of playing.
I do appreciate that, ~name~. It's very nice to see a little bit more of you...
I'm grateful for the opportunity to examine some more of your body, ~name~...
Do you feel any better now that that's off of you, ~name~? (He certainly looks better...)
It's exciting to think of what you might show me in the future, ~name~... or what I might have to show you, for that matter...

case.state: Maybe next time... you could try something a little bigger? I'd be very... honored... if you did.
If you'll remove something bigger next time, I could see if there's a way for me to repay you, ~name~...
You couldn't go a little faster, could you, ~name~? I don't mean to be ungrateful, but I'm sure you'd like to see me conclude, wouldn't you?
If you're feeling shy, perhaps watching me will help to distract you from the embarrassment of disrobing further, ~name~...
Wouldn't it be more... exciting... for us to be watching one another, ~name~, and not just you watching me? Perhaps that would be even more enjoyable than winning...
Air yourself out a little, ~name~... It's very refreshing. I feel quite lovely as I am now...
I'm looking forward to seeing more of you, ~name~.
It's a blessing to see even a little more of your body, ~name~. Thank you.
There's no rush, ~name~... I'm sure we'll see plenty of you in the end...
It's a lovely feeling, being in my position, ~name~. I encourage you to try it soon...
(Even a little more of ~name~ is already quite exciting... I can only imagine what it'll be like when he's out of small things...)
(I can only see a little more, but still... Oh no, I'm "undressing him with my eyes", aren't I? Would Aika be mad at me for that?)
I'm hoping for something more exciting soon, ~name~... I'll be grateful to you...
So, if you lose again next turn, ~name~... you'll take off something really exciting, right?
I don't think our situations are as different as they might appear, ~name~... Before you know it, you may be showing me something interesting as well...

state.text: Oh, my... I probably shouldn't agree to that... but I'm feeling a bit adventurous today. I suppose you could... help me... if I lose, if we agree to some rules... um... But, what would I want...
Oh... do you think so? That's a bit disappointing... I was hoping the game would continue to its... logical conclusion. But, I couldn't fault ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ for feeling shy, I suppose...
Oh? Has ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ done that in games like this with you before? We've played together in the past, and ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ was quite willing to stay to the end...
Do you really think so? That doesn't sound like ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ at all to me... In our past games, ~player.ifMale(he's|she's)~ been a very good sport about losing and forfeiting, so...

Oh? Are you sure about that? Personally, I'm very interested in ~player~'s continued participation in this game... ~player.ifMale(He's|She's)~ been so generous with ~player.ifMale(his|her)~ body so far, after all...

Hmm... I suppose that's true, ~jim~s. It's hard to tell sometimes since ~player.ifMale(he's|she's)~ so quiet sometimes, but I do get the impression that ~player~ has a great many experiences to draw on...
...Does ~player~ truly possess that much knowledge, then? ~player.ifMale(He|She)~ does often appear quite thoughtful...
I really don't mind if you're the one who benefits most... I'm not sure how to cooperate in a game like this, but perhaps we can just be here for each other, if things get difficult.
Oh, well, of course. If you don't enjoy it this time, there's no reason you need to continue playing... Although I suppose you could also play regular poker, without the stripping.
Well, I wouldn't mind that... though I'm not personally worried about it. It's... actually sort of a fun intellectual challenge to figure things out as I go.
Hmmm... are you saying you wanted to come here to increase your popularity? Is strip poker considered an admirable pastime among your peers, then?

I see... Well, your costume does look, ah... fairly menacing, but there are plenty of things like it in the sky. A Grouder has deadly teeth as well, and it can also emit a painful wail, or even use Blue and Purple magic...

Hmm, I see... But, I couldn't abandon my duties on our crew... Are there any ruthless pirates attacking your school that we could take care of, or... lost relics they might be interested in obtaining?
Hmm, and we're always on the move... Actually, ~player~, do you have any advice? I know you're in the Literature Club as well, yet you also find time to travel with L'Arachel, right?
Ah, that's right... I'm not familiar with "Japan", but I assume that's because it is not located in my own world. If I may ask... oh, hello again, Tojiko...
Florina, stay as still as you can! It shouldn't sting you if you---wait, be careful!
Wh-what?! ~sakura~, are you alright?! I can... um, cast Sacrulen? (Does that even work on zombies? What if it hurts them instead?)
Oh no... ~sakura~, your head! (I... guess it's sort of like what happened with ~marker.seenHeadOff~?)
Oh, um... I didn't realize this was that uncomfortable of an experience for you. It's really more distressing than fighting for your life...?
Oh... really? Are you that uncomfortable playing? You seemed quite, um, enthusiastic to discuss sexual topics earlier... Although, I suppose it's different when it isn't you...
I see... I'm not familiar with "Japan", but I assume that's because it is not located in my own world. If I may ask... oh, hello. I didn't realize you'd brought a companion with you...

Oh, I see... Something like Merida, the Ixa'takan dancer we used to have on our crew. That sounds like an important job... keeping people's spirits up can be the difference between victory and defeat.
Well, no, I haven't seen any zombie movies... actually, I'm not even sure what a "movie" is. I think my world must be quite different from yours... (Poor Saki. I wonder how she died...)
Yes... it's very exciting. I've made it a goal of mine to seek out as many new experiences as I can... I don't want to waste another moment of my life. Is that why you're here too, Penny?
Oh, it's interesting that you don't know the source... Is it some sort of innate power that you were born with? Or did you obtain it under unusual circumstances?

Oh, I see... Well, one of the reasons I'm here is to learn more about sexual intimacy... especially the social rules and taboos that appear to surround it. But, I'd also like to learn how to access this "encyclopedia"...
Pokémon... companions? Oh, my...!

No, I'm afraid not... my people, the Silvites, didn't believe in an afterlife. I was taught we simply came from nothing, and would return to that void upon death... but I'm guessing that was another lie.

I see... um, in that case, I was wondering something. You... haven't met anyone named Ramirez in Hell, have you? He's a thin young man with white hair, and he'd probably be in a black military uniform...
I see... And how do you pursue that study nowadays? Do you explore ancient ruins and examine lost artifacts first-hand?
Yes... it was so exciting when I was just getting started, Penny. Honestly, even though I've... done so many things... in these games with ~player~, it's still thrilling to me...
Oh, I see... so it's an unfortunate misunderstanding. Well, perhaps you'll have fun with it anyway? I'm certainly hoping I will, even if this game might get a little, um, intense...

case.state: Oh, I see... so it's an unfortunate misunderstanding. Well, perhaps you'll have fun with it anyway? I'm certainly enjoying it so far, even if the game's getting a little, um, intense...
Oh, I see... so it's an unfortunate misunderstanding. Well, perhaps you'll have fun with it anyway? I've... really been enjoying it myself, honestly...

state.text: Oh, I see... so it's an unfortunate misunderstanding. Well, perhaps you'll have fun with it anyway? It might take you a bit to get used to all the, um, sexuality, but I find it really... invigorating.
Supernova, it's not really either of those, I don't think... our ships are designed to travel through air. Most of Arcadia is sky, so a water ship wouldn't get us very far...
Oh... well, I gather you mean that you were inspired by a successful music group? I'm confused about "shredding", though... Unless your instrument makes musical sounds by tearing things apart?
I see... That does sound interesting. Do you mean to say that different varieties of these creatures changed into others in the past, and you're studying those ancient connections?

Oh, my... That sounds like a difficult situation. But you must be used to being relatively independent, so I suppose that makes it a little easier... If you have access to the supplies you need, anyway.
Oh, that sounds very stressful... Is that how you ended up here? I've gathered this place is as unfamiliar to you as it is to me... Well, more so, if you're not familiar with men.
Moons, that sounds like quite a predicament... Then, are you not engaged in combat much these days? Though, I suppose there's always the threat of wild beasts that attack ships...
Oh, no, your head's come off... ~sakura~, please be careful!
I see... Then, you're a bit like a mortal ruler as well, I suppose. May I ask what your governing philosophy is, in terms of ruling Planeptune?
I see... How interesting. I didn't realize it was possible for humans to be mixed with animals in that way... Is that normal where you're from?
Oh, I see... I'm sorry to hear that. It... can be hard to accept when you're mistaken, maybe even more so when it's important... so I'm glad ~player~ was there to help you through that.
Oh, that sounds wonderful... What's your favorite sub---um... are you okay? Er, sorry... I'll just give you a moment...
Well, if you insist... But don't push yourself too hard, alright? It... doesn't seem this game is the sort of thing you're used to, so...
That sounds wonderful... Where I grew up, we didn't have any real plants or animals, just artificial ones. You're fortunate to have such a pleasant homeland, with nature all around you...
Oh, how interesting... How is it possible to do such things with the mind alone? In my world, gradually attuning yourself to a Moon Stone is the only way we can learn magic...

I see... I'm a specialist in magic myself, and can manipulate those elements in a similar way. Although, I typically focus my efforts on supporting Vyse and Aika with healing when we're fighting together.

case.state: Oh, is that so? Well, I'm sorry for making assumptions, then. I'd love to hear about your plans for dying, if you'd like to share...

state.text: I see... That's a common issue with systems like yours, unfortunately. People in power tend to entrench themselves, and will do terrible things in order to maintain that position...
That's strange... Are you saying that you've come to this place on business, then? I never would have thought of playing strip poker as something one could do professionally...
I see... Do the four of you often spend time together outside of your rehearsals and performances, too? I imagine after that much time, you could have become quite close...

case.state: Ah... well, I suppose so. We are pirates, after all... Though, it's possible to do so while still choosing who you're willing to steal from. We Blue Rogues care a lot about that, but I don't know if Marisa is similar...

state.text: Oh, I see... You mean, films in which you... Well, I could easily imagine there would be a... market for such things... But, I only last year learned of the existence of money, so I hadn't really had the... opportunity to...
In that case, what does your organization plan to do to solve this problem? I imagine anything on such a large scale must be handled carefully, but with enough study, it could be manageable...
Then, it's because they're ambush predators...? That can also happen in the sky, though. Many dangerous species like to hide in the clouds before attacking... and some land animals lurk in bushes...
Yes, that seems wise... And, there are few challenges one can't overcome with a close-knit band of skilled allies. Are there any victories you're particularly proud of?

Oh, my... Are you really thousands of years old? You don't look it at all. The Silvite Elders who raised me did live to that sort of age, but the technology required to do so was quite... visually apparent...
No, no, you're not making the game worse for me... I'm just concerned about your well-being. If it would be better for me not to do anything, though, I could leave you alone...

case.state: Hmmm... Well, I'm certainly used to commanding Cupil in battle. Your Serperior is resilient enough to not be seriously harmed by him? He was designed to kill human soldiers, after all...
I see, that makes sense... Which region are you from, by the way? What sort of place is it...? I'm always interested in hearing about new places we might visit someday...

state.text: Well, Vyse, Aika, and I are the core of our crew. Vyse is our captain, and he's very courageous, determined, and eager for a challenge... while Aika is energetic, cheerful, and fond of treasure hunting.
Oh, if it's that close, I'm tempted to take a look to~background.time~... What is there to see and do there? Is there anywhere you'd recommend I visit?
Oh, i see. I'm not familiar with "bikes" myself... Is that a sort of riding animal, like the Dhabus they use in Nasr? A bike must be a temperamental beast, if it keeps charging into people...
Oh no! Shantae, can you turn back? I might be able to cure you if you give me a moment...
I see... Then, it sounds as though something terrible happened to your world, and this "Naga" managed to send you to an earlier time to prevent it... Is that correct?
Well, hopefully you've come to the right place, then. Here, you'll have a chance to get out of all that heavy armor, and---Oh, my, there's a lot of it, isn't there?
~Sakura~? Your skin is... oh, I see. It's normally that color...
Don't worry, I promise I won't tell anyone about this... Though, I suppose that doesn't really help, since I knew already...
Yes, that's the spirit, ~larachel~! You've come too far to give up now... That's what a Blue Rogue would say.

Oh, so I wasn't just jumping to conclusions? I don't know exactly what that all entails, but it sounds like quite a burden to bear... Did you defeat Sin in the end, then, or did you... choose some other path?
I don't really understand why you took off everything else before your socks, but I... appreciate it, I suppose...
Aimee, you... you can't strip like that, you could hurt someone!
You can't just... shoot your clothes off! You shouldn't be allowed to, I mean! Regardless of whether you physically are able to!
I don't understand why the management of this place even allows this!

Oh, I see.. I suppose that's a little like my Silver Moon Crystal? Except, that seems to contain all of my life energy... I'd show you, but it's inside my chest, so it won't be visible even when I'm naked...

case.state: Oh, I see.. I suppose that's a little like my Silver Moon Crystal? Except, that seems to contain all of my life energy... I'd show you, but it's inside my chest, so you shouldn't be able to see it even now...

state.text: Hmmm... well, it seems to me that many people are afraid of things they don't understand. Perhaps if Aika had met more ghosts, she'd have a more positive opinion of them...
Well... I'd try to assess their skill level, ~tomoko~. I can easily defeat a typical Valuan gunner myself, but for someone with special training and techniques, I'd need to find allies...
You're new to this sort of game, ~name~? I'm fairly new to it as well. But I think it's quite fun once you're used to it.
You're new to this sort of game, ~name~? I was too when I first started coming here, but I got used to it quite quickly. I hope you'll have as much fun here as I have...
This is all quite new to you, ~name~? It is to me as well... But we can support one another, right?
Well, um... I couldn't answer for everyone you know, Penny, but I certainly do. It was a good way of passing the time when I was alone in my room up at the Shrine... Which I nearly always was, so...
Those seem easier to handle than ordinary socks... I have to wear socks in my Air Pirate outfit, but it's a bother keeping track of them, since they're so small.
Oh, so now you're taking that off? That's certainly an unexpected way of doing things...
Oh, I see... You realize your ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(aren't|isn't)~ really covering you at all, don't you, ~name~? There's not going to be much of a difference...
Really? You know, you don't need to remove your ~clothing~ if you'd rather leave ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~ on, ~name~. We've already seen everything important, after all...

Oh? If ~clothing.ifPlural(they're|it's)~ important to you, ~name~, there's no need to remove your ~clothing~ as well. I'd be fine with you performing for us while still wearing ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~...

Ah, I see... your ~clothing~ ~clothing.ifPlural(look|looks)~ very beautiful on you, especially when there's little else you're wearing, but... I won't object to ~clothing.ifPlural(their|its)~ removal, either...
This is a bit of a change of course, isn't it, ~name~? Did you just want to show us some of your body right away?
This is a very interesting way to strip, ~name~, especially for a woman... Does your culture have different taboos than I'm used to?
I wasn't really expecting your ~clothing~ to be next, but I suppose the order won't matter for most of us in the end, will it...?
Have you attended many of these games in the past, ~name~? I can understand one might want to try unusual stripping orders in that case, just for variety's sake...
~Name~, I'm a little confused by the way you're choosing to strip. Are you more uncertain about certain... regions... of your body than others?
So it'll be your ~clothing~ next, then?
~clothing.ifPlural(Do|Does)~ your ~clothing~ have any interesting properties, ~name~? I've seen some that increased quickness or willpower in battle...
(Hmm, that's a good start, I think...)
Your ~clothing~, ~name~? I think that's a good choice. You'll likely be more comfortable without ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~...
I hope you're enjoying yourself, ~name~. I've been finding this game quite exciting so far...

case.state: I see... that's nice. That should help a little bit...
Anything you can show me is lovely, ~name~, no matter the size.
You're removing your ~clothing~? I'm looking forward to it...

(I really don't care what it is at this point... I shouldn't be affected at all by ~name~ taking off something as inconsequential as her ~clothing~, but that's clearly not the reality of the situation...)
I appreciate even the smallest gift, ~name~...
(It seems ~name~ is still hanging in there with her ~clothing~...)
Good, no need to rush yourself, ~name~.
Are you feeling good about your chances, ~name~?
It seems as though you're not in much danger still, ~name~... Not that there's "danger" of anything really terrible happening...
~clothing.ifPlural(Are|Is)~ your ~clothing~ making you uncomfortable, ~name~? I'd suggest that you simply remove ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~...
I think you're starting to catch up to me, ~name~...
Now things are getting a little more interesting...
You should be careful, ~name~, or you might end up like me soon...
Well, you're managing to avoid exposure for the moment, ~name~... Though, it's actually more pleasant than you might expect...
(I don't think I'm that far behind ~name~... There should still be time to catch up with her...)

state.text: When Vyse, Aika and I first met, they agreed to help me with my mission to keep the Moon Crystals out of the hands of the Valuan Empire, so that they couldn't abuse their power...

Vyse, Aika, and I traveled all over the world searching for the Moon Crystals. Those days, when I first got to know them and we gradually became the best of friends... Those are my most treasured memories.

I first met Vyse and Aika when my ship was captured by Admiral Alfonso. He wanted to bring me to the Empress so my knowledge of the Moon Crystals could be used to help the Valuans conquer the world...
Oh, my... um... this conversation isn't actually about information and sources, is it?
That's actually... quite a good philosophy. I'd much rather have a ruler who's... non-interactive... than one who forces their ideology onto everyone else... No offense, ~miko~.
Oh... Do you need help with... ah, you got it off... Anyway, if it were up to me, I wouldn't want any empires at all... I don't know if the advantages are worth all the potential for abuse.
Please, just take off your clothes with your hands like everyone else d---(Oh no! I didn't mean...) I'm really sorry, ~rin~, I just meant... She shouldn't be shooting them off!
Well... we've only just started, so I suppose we could ask. Personally, I like the stripping, but... I do want to try ordinary poker sometime, as well...

I don't know, ~nagisa~... We've already been playing this way for a while, so it seems a bit late for that. I'd be alright with it if you stopped stripping and kept track of your score some other way, though...
Maybe so, ~nagisa~, but... they'll be much more exciting as well, I think. Frightening things can also be... wonderful...
Perhaps so, ~nagisa~, but... much more exciting as well, I'm hoping...
Oh, don't worry, ~estelle~... It looks quite endearing mussed up that way. Anyway, as far as empires go, I don't know if the advantages are worth all the potential for abuse...
Oh, how impressive... I don't know any magic specifically for removing clothes. Anyway, as far as empires go, I don't know if the advantages are worth all the potential for abuse...
Oh, is that so? I'm so happy she was able to inspire you like that... What is her name?
Hmmm... I'm tempted to ask for more specifics, but this seems like too personal of an experience to discuss in public... I should probably stop prying.

If you... want to be more specific about what happened, it's just me and ~player~ here... It sounds very personal, but I promise not to tell anyone... But, only if you're comfortable with it, of course...
Well... if you're comfortable being more specific about what happened, it's just you and your club here... I promise I won't tell anyone, no matter what it is.
I see. Perhaps you were somehow blessed by the Purple Moon at birth... Though, I don't know if your world even has a Purple Moon. I've gotten the impression it's rather different from mine.

Drones from this planet? Moons, how strange. Of course, I really only know about this place in a strip poker context, so I suppose those likely have nothing to do with the Inventory... Well, I hope so, anyway...
How strange... The Inventory does appear to operate outside the normal rules I'm familiar with. Perhaps it interacts with time differently, as well...
That's such a long time to have been alive... The Silvite Elders lived for centuries as well, but only with great aid from the Silver Moon. But I gather you're very skilled in Silver magic, so...
I see... Well, in that case, thank you for offering, Wikipe-tan. (She just means I can ask her more questions, right...?)
Oh, I see... then you're a zombie? Um, I apologize if this is obvious to everyone, but... what exactly is a "zombie"?
Drones from Earth... and you think that might be future Arcadia? Well, I don't think I can give you much more information. That sounds far beyond the capabilities we have at the moment...

I see... then that's why you suspect we're not from the same time period. Well, given what I've seen here so far, the Inventory certainly doesn't appear to obey the laws of space and time I'm familiar with...
Centuries?? I didn't realize she was that old... I suppose the Silvite Elders lived for centuries as well, but only with great aid from the Silver Moon. Are you that skilled in Silver magic, Miko?
Oh, I see. Well... I sympathize, actually. I... don't have as much knowledge as I'd like about how I... came to be, either. But, I suppose one doesn't really need to in order to enjoy one's life...
That was so dramatic... I can see you're quite skilled at being inspirational, Elesa.
Ah, I see... So you're attempting to lift the spirits of everyone in your home with your performances... Er, or rather, the people who are idols are doing so. That's very noble of... them.
I see... That makes sense. I've encountered several cultures with legends that were based on ancient events, though sometimes they were greatly distorted.
Um... I feel as though I should have a better idea of the significance of this. What sort of being are you, if not human? Don't worry, I'm not going to run or anything!

I quite understand. I joined forces with pirates soon after leaving my home... If I hadn't, I would surely have died before completing my mission. Perhaps you'll even find wonderful new friends, like I did...
That sounds exciting... The elites of Valua apparently had skilled "virtuoso" musicians who could perform such feats, but I've never seen it in person. Could I see your "shredding" after the game?
Oh, my... Even fish people? We've encountered all sorts of strange fish creatures in the skies, but I don't believe I've ever seen one that was anything like a person...
Oh, I see... You changed your mind. Well, good... You should do this however is most comfortable for you. We'll all enjoy the game more that way, too...
Interesting... You know, that's actually not a bad philosophy for a ruler, compared to some I've seen. If Empress Teodora had ruled Valua that way, it would have been a significant improvement...
That's... actually not a bad way of thinking about it. Perhaps you should just dissolve your monarchy, and switch to something more community-focused? It sounds like you're halfway there already...

case.state: Yes, my people were skilled at creating artificial life out of metal and crystal, or even out of light... but it's not really the same. Beings like that don't do any more than follow your instructions...

Yes, the Silvites created artificial plants and animals out of metal, crystal, or even light... like Cupil here. But, as much as I love Cupil, he's made mostly to do what I tell him to... as were all our creations.

state.text: How interesting... The Magypsies sound a bit similar to the Silvite Elders, actually, although they didn't teach me PSI. Are they long-lived because they modify their bodies with Silver magic and technology?
I see.... That's fascinating. I suppose one would have to ask them to find out if one had such potential?

Oh, my... That's quite an interesting name for an "ultimate" spell. I don't know anything like that myself, though... We typically call in the rest of the crew to support us if we need to end things quickly.
Oh! You really had me worried for a second there, ~hu_tao~. You didn't strike me as the sort of person who didn't know what they were getting into, but... I didn't want to make assumptions...
Oh, I see... Well, that explains my confusion. I certainly hadn't gotten the impression this game was particularly disconcerting for you...

case.state: A lavish celebration? That sounds quite nice... I like the idea of making something pleasant out of your own death. It might soften the blow for those who cared about you...

state.text: Well, I wouldn't be surprised if I lose quite quickly, since I don't have much idea what I'm doing. So, perhaps that will entice ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ to stay with us for quite a while... I hope so, anyway.
That's true... At least as far as I'm concerned, I suppose I'm doing plenty to... encourage... ~player~ to stay, anyway... You've been a bit luckier than me so far.

Well, this place has strict rules about not pressuring other players to do anything uncomfortable, so if it's too much for ~player.ifMale(him|her)~, I'm sure ~player.ifMale(he'll|she'll)~ leave immediately...

case.state: Oh, well... I don't know about "no matter what". I certainly wouldn't want ~player~ to stay any longer than ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ wanted to... But, obviously I hope that everyone will remain comfortable...

state.text: Oh... was that too forward? It seems better to me to be open about what I'm thinking, but I wouldn't want to make you or ~player~ uncomfortable... I'm still a bit unused to socializing.
Well, in that case, let's take ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ down together. If you know each other that well, I imagine ~player.ifMale(he'll|she'll)~ be even more willing to continue for us than usual...
Well, we certainly have plenty of gold pieces, as well as magical crystals and other items to trade... I suppose we'd need to come for a visit to know if we could make it work.
(Oh... do you really think so, ~yuri~? Well... I suppose I haven't seen much evidence...) Anyway, perhaps we'd need to come for a visit to really know what would and wouldn't be feasible...

Well, I was somewhat sheltered growing up... in that I lived in a shrine above the clouds with at most one other ordinary human for seventeen years. But, in that case, I'd certainly like to learn more about it...

That makes sense... Vyse, Aika, and I are similar, since we ended up traveling together for so long. There's nothing like... finding a group of people who feel like home, is there? It's been wonderful for me, at least...
Well, I do want to keep talking to you, so... In that case, that's what I'll do. It sounds like that's what would be most helpful for you as well.
I see... Was that because Eros was a particularly powerful foe, or because the consequences of defeating them were particularly important for accomplishing your goals?

I think I understand. There were several cases where our efforts against the Valuan Armada only furthered their goals... Though frightening at the time, it's now very satisfying that we managed to win.
Oh, dear... I understand how fighting together could produce such feelings over time, but I gather the sentiment wasn't mutual...
Yes, that's exactly right. I know I can trust Vyse and Aika with anything, and that we'll always look out for one another... I hope we can spend the rest of our lives sailing the skies together.
Stealing from someone simply for being annoying seems unjust, but I see no issue with robbing someone who exploits and mistreats others... But, to each their own code, I suppose.

You must have seen so many things in such a long lifetime. I can only imagine having that much time to explore both the world and oneself... I suppose to~background.time~ you'll be exploring the latter.
I'm glad you seem to be alright, ~sakura~. I'm... not sure why you're alright, but I imagine this is another "zombie" thing that is obvious to everyone else, isn't it?
Um... don't worry, I won't run or anything! I promise you, I don't have anything against zombies... Partly because I'm still not completely sure what they are...
I know it doesn't hurt you terribly when that happens, but... I don't think I'm going to get used to it any time soon...
Sayaka, look out! There's some sort of monster right behind you!
Please don't lie to us, Aimee. No one could control all those bullets, which is exactly why this is so irresponsible! (Not to mention, infuriatingly sexy!)
Please, just take off your clothes with your hands like everyone else! (Wait... am I getting turned on? Why!?)
Oh, um, Bernie, you can probably strip those one at a time... You might as well take this slow, since it's new to you...
Oh, goodness... Myriam, this is starting to get a bit silly, isn't it? I can't deny I'm entertained, though...
Is that unusual, ~misaka~? It seems like a sensible enough choice to me, but then again, I'm still not very familiar with clothing conventions...

That's a good idea... um, although I'm not sure if she'd be willing to come to something as "perverted" as a strip poker game. But, perhaps if I tell her about my experiences here, she'll be willing to try it...

case.state: Oh, I think I was confused... When you say "evolve", do you mean an individual can change into another type of creature altogether? That sounds like what Silver animals do...
Oh, I see... When you say "evolve", do you mean an individual can change into another type of creature altogether? Silver animals like Cupil can do much the same thing, I think.

state.text: A single Moon Crystal contains the concentrated power of tens of thousands of ordinary ones... They were used to control the Gigas, living weapons of mass destruction... far too powerful to ever be used.
After all we've been through, we've become closer than family... we'd go anywhere, or do anything, together. (...Come to think of it, I wonder if there's some... new things we could try...)

Vyse and Aika happened to attack Alfonso's ship while I was on it, and they found me and took me back to Pirate Isle with them... and ever since then, they've always come for me whenever I'm in danger.
I'm not sure why you didn't take your jacket off earlier, ~name~... In this heat, I suppose it'd be more comfortable than a top, but quite... daring...
I'm not sure why you didn't take your jacket off earlier, ~name~... It can't be much warmer than your top, so why not take it off first, instead of going to all that trouble?
Those must keep your legs nice and warm, ~name~. But, I can't imagine that you'd need to worry about that here...
Those must keep your legs nice and warm, ~name~. Um... you aren't going to be cold now, are you?
It's a bit hot here to be wearing a jacket, ~name~... I can't blame you.
Aren't you going to be cold without your jacket, ~name~? I'd be alright with huddling together for warmth if that happens...
I don't really understand what your methodology is here, ~name~, but... I guess I'm not complaining either...

case.state: Whenever the player in slot 1 (other than a duplicate Fina) loses a round, assigns the value "met" to them in MetNPC if they have already been counted by FamiliarFaces. These cases should keep track of which characters Fina has met before without needing a separate marker for each.

Whenever the player in slot 2 (other than a duplicate Fina) loses a round, assigns the value "met" to them in MetNPC if they have already been counted by FamiliarFaces. These cases should keep track of which characters Fina has met before without needing a separate marker for each.

Whenever the player in slot 3 (other than a duplicate Fina) loses a round, assigns the value "met" to them in MetNPC if they have already been counted by FamiliarFaces. These cases should keep track of which characters Fina has met before without needing a separate marker for each.

Whenever the player in slot 4 (other than a duplicate Fina) loses a round, assigns the value "met" to them in MetNPC if they have already been counted by FamiliarFaces. These cases should keep track of which characters Fina has met before without needing a separate marker for each.
If any player is stripping their Halloween alt costume, Fina will remember that she's seen them wearing it before. Assigns "seen" to the marker seenHalloweenSkin if it's not already stored there.

If any player is stripping in an alt skin, Fina will remember that she's seen them wearing at least one alt skin before (does not remember individual skins). Assigns "seen" to the marker seenAltSkin if it's not already stored there.
If any player is stripping their Christmas alt costume, Fina will remember that she's seen them wearing it before. Assigns "seen" to the marker seenChristmasSkin if it's not already stored there.

Um, everyone, do I spend too much time talking about the history and culture of my world? It's... the only real value I got out of my upbringing, so... I might overdo it sometimes.
The Red Moon in my world is associated with fire and power. Because so many Red Moon Stones fall on the lands of Nasr, they've become a desert where plant life cannot grow.
The Green Moon in my world is associated with growth and healing. Because it shines strongly over Ixa'taka, that country is covered in lush jungles and forests teeming with life.
The Blue Moon in my world is associated with wind and water. The people of Yafutoma use its power to build ships that can fly far higher or lower in the sky than those of other nations.

The Purple Moon in my world is associated with ice and the mind. It shines over the Lands of Ice, which are uninhabited by humans today. (Uninhabited by humans... That definitely doesn't describe anything related to the Moon in this game...)
The Yellow Moon in my world is associated with electricity. It creates great thunderclouds over the nation of Valua, which provide abundant power, but also perpetually cover the land in darkness.

In addition to the six ordinary Moons in my world, it's possible a Black Moon exists. There's a Moon Stone in the Dark Rift that might have come from a hypothetical Black Moon... but if it's real, nothing is known about it.

Rather than use their powerful magic and technology to aid the poor and needy, the ancient civilizations of my world created terrible living weapons called the Gigas, and set them against each other in battle. It was the Gigas that brought an end to the Old World... So many people died as a result.

Our world has six Moons, each of a different color... Green, Red, Blue, Purple, Yellow, and Silver. Each has a different power channeled through the Moon Stones that fall from the sky. Moon Stones are used in many types of advanced technology, such as airships, and can also be used to perform magic. For that reason, many of us have great reverence for the Moons.

Recumen, the Red Gigas, was the first Gigas we encountered. He nearly destroyed Drachma's ship, the Little Jack, with his heat rays. We were unable to destroy him, but managed to deactivate him and recover the Red Moon Crystal that controls him.

We encountered Grendel, the Green Gigas, in Ixa'taka. The king there attempted to use his power to drive away the invading Valuans, but soon lost control of him and he turned his mighty fists on everything in sight. Fortunately, we were able to subdue him until the Green Moon Crystal could be recovered.

We fought Bluheim, the Blue Gigas, in the land of Yafutoma during a battle with the Valuan Armada. Most of the ships were blown away by his Blue Winds, but Prince Enrique's flagship, the Delphinus, gave us enough power to destroy him.

Yeligar, the Yellow Gigas, had been sealed away in the ancient caverns beneath Valua. We were unable to take his Yellow Moon Crystal from him without waking him, and were forced to face his lightning in order to destroy him in the Delphinus.

Plergoth was the Purple Gigas, whom the Purple Civilization of old created by implanting the Purple Moon Crystal in an unfortunate arcwhale. Well... in the end, he passed away, and we obtained the Purple Moon Crystal... but I think I won't dwell on it further.

The world of Arcadia, as my people called it, is a world of floating islands in an endless sky. Humans and other creatures inhabit the islands and must use airships to travel from one to the next. I'm not certain what causes the islands to float, but I believe it is the power of the Moon Stones that commonly fall and become embedded in them, as those stones are commonly used to make ships fly as well.

Silver Magic is my specialty. The Silver Moon governs life, death and void, and its magic is useful for reviving those who fall in battle as well as snuffing out a foe's life in an instant. Um, but it has some more mundane applications as well, which are especially useful for sexually active women... if any of you find that helpful in the future, I'd be happy to cast some for you.

The Green Moon in my world is associated with growth and healing. Because it shines strongly over Ixa'taka, that country is covered in lush jungles and forests teeming with life. (Oh, dear... teeming with life... I... suppose that's certainly one way to put it...)
The Purple Moon in my world is associated with ice and the mind. It shines over the Lands of Ice, which are uninhabited by humans today. The fate of the civilization that once lived there is unknown.

The Yellow Moon in my world, which is... obviously unrelated to anyone currently playing with us, is associated with electricity. It creates great thunderclouds over the nation of Valua, which provide abundant power, but also perpetually cover the land in darkness.

The Blue Moon in my world is associated with wind and... water... (Oh dear, I really don't need to associate any Moons here with water right now...) Anyway, the people of Yafutoma use its power to build ships that can fly far higher or lower in the sky than those of other nations.

Green Magic draws power from the Green Moon, which governs growth and healing. Its magic can be used to poison foes, but it's most useful for healing wounds... and I've found it's also quite effective at, um, rejuvenating the body, even if one's not exactly wounded... For a man in particular, that could have some enjoyable applications.

Blue Magic draws power from the Blue Moon, which governs wind, water, and fluidity. Its magic can be used to conjure whirlwinds of water and air with which to attack foes, as well as to increase one's speed and reaction time, and it can even put foes to sleep. Or allies, I suppose... I could see that having some interesting... applications... If everyone involved agreed to it, of course...

Yellow Magic draws power from the Yellow Moon, which governs power, energy and virility. It can be used to conjure lightning to electrocute foes, and some spells can also drain the energy from a foe's body, leaving them in a greatly weakened state. Um... though, come to think of it, perhaps being put into a weakened state wouldn't be so unpleasant, if it were all done... consensually.

Red Magic draws power from the Red Moon, which governs fire, destruction, and power. Red spells are capable of creating huge fiery explosions to attack multiple foes at once, and are also capable of increasing the offensive and defensive capabilities of an ally. I... do have to wonder about non-combat applications, as well... boosting a partner's capabilities could prove... quite exciting, I'd think...

Red Magic draws power from the Red Moon... unrelated to anyone in this game, naturally... which governs fire, destruction, and power. Purple Magic draws power from the Purple Moon, which governs ice, will, and spirit. Purple spells are very effective at attacking a single foe by encasing them in ice, and mind-altering Purple spells can silence a foe to prevent them from casting, or confound them to attack blindly. I... have to wonder what applications there might be on friendly targets... If it were my choice, maybe having my mind altered could be... interesting...

Most sailors and Air Pirates sooner or later make their way to Sailor's Island, because its location in Mid Ocean between Valua to the north and Nasr to the east makes it an important trade hub. The Sailor's Guild there deals in information on new discoveries and bounties on dangerous Black Pirates, and the tavern is an excellent place to hear the latest rumors and tales of distant lands. And their loqua is delicious, too!

Nasr is a civilization in the great deserts under the Red Moon, east of Sailor's Island and southeast of Valua. The Nasreans are skilled merchants and warriors, and the only civilization that posed a military threat to the old Valuan Empire. On land, they ride creatures called Dhabus to protect their feet from the scorching sands, and they love spicy cooking. They're traditionally ruled by the Nasultan, who lives in the capital city of Nasrad.

Valua is a civilization under the Yellow Moon, and the most technologically advanced nation of the modern era... The electric power provided by Yellow Moon Stones allowed them to build great factories, powerful metal ships, and weapons like the Moon Stone Cannon that are powerful enough to rival a Gigas. But with our old friends Enrique and Moegi ruling the Empire, they're no longer a threat to the rest of the world... I really hope it stays that way.

Ixa'taka lies across South Ocean, a dangerous region of sky that few ships have successfully crossed. A peaceful people isolated from more warlike nations, the Ixa'takans once used weapons only for hunting and defense against wild beasts. Unfortunately, Valua's arrival forced them to turn their weapons on other humans to defend themselves. But, with Valua defeated, I hope they'll be able to return to their old way of life...

You're welcome to take a picture of me, ~camera~... As long as you keep it to yourself, I'm really not worried about it anymore...

If she has played against a chubby human player for at least 10 rounds, Fina will remember their body type in the future.
If she has played against an athletic human player for at least 10 rounds, Fina will remember their body type in the future.
If she has played against a skinny human player for at least 10 rounds, Fina will remember their body type in the future.

If Fina has played at least 10 rounds with Nugi-chan, she'll recognize her when they play together again. Now used only to check whether Fina remembers her or not for the purpose of responding to her Opponent Selected line.
If the player has previously lost to Fina, increments the collectible counter for her earrings.
If the player has previously lost alongside Fina, increments the collectible counter for her earrings.

If the markers "victorious", "lostToYou" and "lostWithYou" are all active, sets the closeFriend persistent marker. Those three come as a set in conditions very often, so I'd rather streamline things a bit.
If Fina is in slot 1, stores the value "self" in slotOne to prevent her from counting herself for FamiliarFaces.
If Fina is in slot 2, stores the value "self" in slotTwo to prevent her from counting herself for FamiliarFaces.
If Fina is in slot 3, stores the value "self" in slotThree to prevent her from counting herself for FamiliarFaces.
If Fina is in slot 4, stores the value "self" in slotFour to prevent her from counting herself for FamiliarFaces.
Records the first time Fina says her "petrify" line during orgasm, and increments the counter for her collectible.

state.text: If the human player has stripped in a silly order that makes Fina laugh (marked by storing "human" in the marker sillyOrder with target.id), increments the counter for her drink pass collectible.

case.state: Sets the "nextLevel" marker if the player has earned all Fina's basic collectibles. This doesn't do much yet, but will probably be important in the future.

If Fina has played at least 10 rounds with Zoe, she'll recognize her when they play together again. Used to fix her broken interactions where she was supposed to respond differently depending on whether they'd met, but per-target markers don't work that way.

If Fina has refused to call the player Master or Mistress in a game, she'll remember they tried to get her to do so. When she warms up to them enough to be comfortable with it, she'll be able to bring it up with them again as a suggestion...
